result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel E Stenman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: with any other sentence and the revocation defendant is currently serving.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel E Stenman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joel E Stenman in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Joel E Stenman in custody.  Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence and the revocation he is currently serving, credit for 18 days time served.     
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge as a condition of ES in Washington County case 13CF0361, and any balance within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Joel E Stenman not in court, in custody.   Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision, to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joel E Stenman in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Joel E Stenman in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel E Stenman
Current: 101W16139 Santa Fe Drive, Germantown, WI 53022 United States  (Effective: 01-13-2014)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
